metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3159 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A use after free issue was discovered in driver/firewire in outbound_phy_packet_callback in the Linux Kernel. In this flaw a local attacker with special privilege may cause a use after free problem when queue_event() fails. It was discovered that a use-after-free vulnerability existed in the IEEE 1394 (Firewire) implementation in the Linux kernel. A privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3159` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-lowlatency - 4.4.0-243.277
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1159-aws - 4.4.0-1159.174
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
